title: OSAL Wrapper for Zephyr on R-Car V4H

description: This document describes updates and restrictions for this release.
This document describes the contents regarding to the OSAL Wrapper for Zephyr on R-Car V4H.

note: The Current/Target Quality grades options are below:
- Current: Sample, Reference, Alpha Beta, QM, ASIL

description: Copyright(C) [2022-2023] Renesas Electronics Corporation. All rights reserved.

section.name: Version 0.1.0
description: - This software is verified by sample application only.

section.name: Version 0.2.0
description: - The following restriction is moved to the Wrapper User's Manual.

section.name: Version 0.3.0
description: - Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- The following restriction is moved to the Wrapper User's Manual.

section.name: Version 0.4.0
description: - Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Supported the device-tree as OSAL Device configuration.
- Update thread and message queue for CPURTT
- Update condition variable for VISION IP

section.name: Version 0.5.0
description: - Change the thread name of interrupt thread defined in the Resource information. No impact on API behavior. \n
- Added following issue, Table 3-1 has more details.
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 0.6.0
description: - The implementation was restructured to separate OS-dependent processing part and OS-independent processing part. (ASDRCXPOSAL-1154)
- According to the above changes, the structure of the User's Manual has changed.
- Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Resolved following Known Issues List, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 0.7.0
description: - Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Resolved following Known Issues List, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Added following issue to Known Issues List.

section.name: Version 0.8.0
description: - Set CPU affinity so that target thread run on the specified CPU cores.
- Added CPU affinity value and corespond thread to OSAL Configuration.
- Resolved following Known Issues List, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 0.9.0
description: - The memory map has been updated to change the start address of user allocatable area from \n 0xA0000000 to 0x60000000 [ASDRCXPOSAL-1582].
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

table.description: [ver 0.2.0] Disabled cache same as Zephyr BSP due to incorrect cache enable setting.
[ver 0.3.0] Most of the functions of the OSAL PM API are dummy implementations.
[ver 0.3.0] AXI bus APIs are not supported.
[ver 0.3.0] The message sending API may return OSAL_RETURN_FAIL when called from an interrupt context.
[ver 0.4.0] Prevent OSAL Message sending API from using internal message queue.
[ver 0.4.0] When R_OSAL_MmngrOpen() is called with 'config.max_registered_monitors_cbs = 0', it return OSAL_RETURN_MEM.
[ver 0.5.0] Calling R_OSAL_Deinitialize() does not release created thread.

description: [ver 0.6.0] Verified for OSAL APIs behavior by API Functional Test.
[ver 0.6.0] Memory Chase is enabled from ver 0.6.0. \n
As a result, the following APIs are now available \n
[ver 0.6.0] Supported following Multi Memory Region APIs. \n
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed return value when Mutex Lock failed with the following API in interrupt context. \n
Fixed return value from OSAL_RETURN_FAIL to OSAL_RETURN_BUSY. \n
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed return value when specifying handle to following OSAL Power Manager API with no assigned power/clock/reset control. \n
Return value changed from OSAL_RETURN_FAIL to OSAL_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION. \n
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed an issue where specifying a handle with only reset control assigned to the OSAL Power Manager API caused unintended HW access. \n
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed behavior of R_OSAL_ThsyncMutexLockForTimePeriod and R_OSAL_ThsyncMutexLockUntilTimeStamp. \n
The above API had the following issue. \n
- When waiting for Mutex used in Condition Variable with the above API, OSAL_RETURN_TIME is returned even though it is not Timeout time.
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed return value from OSAL API when try to lock a specific Mutex multiple times in same thread. \n
Fixed return value from OSAL_RETURN_FAIL to OSAL_RETURN_BUSY. \n
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed R_OSAL_PmWaitForState wait time longer than specified time.
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed issue that handle specified as argument is overwritten to NULL when specified already opened device with R_OSAL_IoDeviceOpen.
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed issue that upper 32 bits and lower 32 bits are reversed in API for 64bit IO Read/Write. \n
[ver 0.6.0] Fixed issue that the reserved area is not secured when opening the memory area by using R_OSAL_MmngrOpen.
[ver 0.7.0] Fixed the unintentional return of OSAL_RETURN_FAIL when executing R_OSAL_Deinitialize by changed the method of manage the internal semaphore. \n

[ver 0.7.0] Fixed the issue that the expected power state is not achieved when controlling multiple devices with shared clocks and resets with different parameters by using the OSAL Power Manager API. \n

[ver 0.8.0] For devices that cannot transition to OSAL_PM_STATE_PG, R_OSAL_PmGetLowestIntermediatePowerState may return OSAL_PM_STATE_PG against the expected lowest intermediate power state OSAL_PM_STATE_CG.
[ver 0.8.0] Fixed R_OSAL_PmWaitForState cannot wait state transition of the HWA unsupporting reset operation.
[ver 0.8.0] Fixed to following OSAL Power manager behavior \n
- Fixed the power control dependencies between imp_dma_slim and imp_spmc. \n
- Fixed vdsp0x_02 to vdsp0x_07 to be reset-only devices. Specifying these devices to the following OSAL Power APIs return OSAL_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION. \n
[ver 0.9.0] Fixed resource release leak in R_OSAL_DeInitialize.
[ver 0.9.0] Zephyr's cond_wait sometimes did not lock mutex when returning, and some OSAL APIs behaved differently than specification. \n
- Fixed to always lock mutex when R_OSAL_ThsyncCondWaitForTimePeriod and R_OSAL_ThsyncCondWaitUntilTimeStamp return OSAL_RETURN_OK. \n
- Fixed issue that the user function was not called even if R_OSAL_ThreadCreate returns OSAL_RETURN_OK. \n
- Fixed an issue where the following OSAL APIs returned OSAL_RETURN_FAIL. \n

sum: Updated OSAL API version in Table 1-1 \n
Added ASDRCXPOSAL-931 to Known Issue List
Removed ASDRCXPOSAL-931 to Known Issue List \n
Added ASDRCXPOSAL-1088, ASDRCXPOSAL-1106 to Known Issue List \n
